definition: water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes

clothes/dress/garment/to serve (in the military, a prison sentence etc)/to obey/to be convinced (by an argument)/to convince/to admire/to acclimatize/to take (medicine)/mourning clothes/to wear mourning clothes

sentences.english: By trapping air, hair could make diving suits more buoyant, Nasto says.
sentences.chinese: 毛髮可以通過困住空氣，使潛水服獲得更多浮力。

sentences.english: Since she is a land creature, she needs to wear a pressurized suit under the sea.
sentences.chinese: 珊迪是陸地生物，所以在海里她需要穿着潛水服。

sentences.english: They've invited all their friends (but only the four that know how to scuba dive are going to attended. ) Lillian had a special white wedding wetsuit made.
sentences.chinese: 莉莉安訂做了一件特別的白色婚禮用保溫潛水服。

sentences.english: I dug it out and slipped it into my wetsuit as a souvenir.
sentences.chinese: 我把它挖出來塞進我的潛水服裏留做紀念。

sentences.english: We had to put on a wetsuit to go scuba diving.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須穿上保溫潛水服才能進行水肺潛水。
